You are given a square with side length $n$.  A person starts at the bottom left corner of the square and walks along the perimeter in a clockwise direction. Every time they walk ($n+1$) meters, they draw a cross. The person stops when the bottom left corner of the square has two crosses.  

Write a program to determine the total number of crosses drawn.

Input:

The first line contains an integer $t$ (1 ≤ $t$ ≤ 10⁴) representing the number of test cases.

The second line contains $t$ space-separated integers $n_i$ (1 ≤ $n_i$ ≤ 10⁹) representing the side lengths of the squares for each test case.

Output:

For each test case, print the number of crosses drawn on a single line. Print the answers in the order they appear in the input.

A square is drawn.  A person walks around the outside of the square, placing a mark every (side length + 1) meters.  They keep walking until the starting corner has two marks. How many marks are placed in total?
